content: / 7 5 cm ribbed cuff / front round 1 *k2 p2 repeat from * to bor repeat round 1 for 3 / 7 5 cm begin working ribbing on front of sock and st st on back as follows round 1 k2 p2 6 7 7 8 times k2 1 0 1 0 times k22 24 26 28 repeat round 1 for 3 / 7 5 cm heel flap knit the first 24 26 28 30 sts and then working back and forth across next 24 26 28 30 sts only work heel flap as follows row 1 rs sl1 knitwise k to end of row row 2 ws sl1 knitwise p to end of row repeat row 1-2 8 9 9 10 times more 18 20 20 22 row completed © sonder yarn co 2022 | www sonderyarnco com | for personal use only the indoorsy socks | page 4 turn heel row 1 rs sl1 purlwise k13 14 15 16 ssk k1 turn row 2 ws sl1 purlwise p5 p2tog p1 turn row 3 sl1 purlwise k6 k2tog tbl k1 turn row 4 sl1 purlwise p7 p2tog p1 turn continue working in this manner working 1 additional st before the decrease on each row until 14 16 18 20 sts remain ending with a ws row shape gusset sl1 k across sts of heel then pick up and knit 9 10 10 11 sts along the side of the heel into selvedge sts work as established across 24 26 28 30 sts of top of foot pick up and knit 9 10 10 11 sts along side of heel then knit the first 7 8 9 10 sts of heel if desired place marker for beginning of round - 56 62 66 72 sts from here until toe shaping the beginning of the round is in the middle of the heel work 1 round in pattern gusset decreases begin with the next round round 1 k13 15 16 18 k2tog k1 work in pattern across top of foot k1 ssk k to end of round round 2 work in pattern repeat rnds 1-2 working 1 less stitch before the k2tog until 48 52 56 60 sts remain ending with round 2 foot continue working as established until foot measures desired length about 1 75 / 4 5 cm less than foot length refer to chart at the end of pattern for more information about foot length by shoe size shape toe set up row for shifting beginning of round bor remove marker k12 13 14 15 place new bor marker side of foot k24 26 28 30 pm knit to end of round round 1 k1 ssk knit to 3 sts before marker k2tog k1 sm k1 ssk knit to 3 sts before marker k2tog k1 - 44 48 52 56 sts remain round 2 knit repeat rnds 1-2 until 32 sts remain 16 between each marker repeat round 1 until 16 sts remain 8 sts between
